0_Atelectasis: Alveolar architecture collapses, with alveolar spaces obliterated and appearing slit-like.
Alveolar walls become apposed, and capillary lumens are markedly narrowed.
1_Cardiomegaly: Myocyte hypertrophy with enlarged hyperchromatic nuclei, mixed with myocyte atrophy and focal interstitial fibrosis
2_Effusion: Cytology shows a background of red blood cells with a rich population of neutrophils and eosinophils
Reactive mesothelial cells and scattered lymphocytes
cattered cells with prominent nucleoli with some cells having irregular nuclear membrane, Consistent with atypical hyperplasia of uncertain significance
3_Infiltration: The tumor exhibits a predominant lepidic pattern, growing along intact alveolar walls. Focal stromal invasion is present.
The tumor is composed of a mixture of invasive acinar structures and sheets of solid growth.
The tumor demonstrates a predominant papillary pattern with fibrovascular cores, showing invasive growth.
4_Mass: Primitive round cells arranged in nests with fibrovascular septa; wreath-like multinucleated giant cells and rhabdomyoblasts are present; brisk mitotic activity with necrosis. Findings are consistent with Alveolar Rhabdomyosarcoma.

Lobulated and well-circumscribed tumor architecture, accompanied by osteoclast-like multinucleated giant cells, hemosiderin deposition, and stromal hyalinization. Findings are consistent with giant cell tumor.

The tumor is well-circumscribed. It is normocellular and composed of intersecting fascicles of monotonous spindle cells with indistinct borders, abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm, and characteristic cigar-shaped nuclei containing uniform chromatin and small nucleoli. Findings are consistent with leiomyoma.
5_Nodule: The section shows a central zone of fibrinoid necrosis surrounded by a palisade of epithelioid histiocytes and lymphocytes. Consistent with Rheumatoid Nodule.

Epithelioid cell proliferation forming a nodule. The cells have vesicular nuclei, prominent nucleoli, and abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm. Focal vascular lumen formation is seen, accompanied by a mild chronic inflammatory cell infiltrate. Consistent with a Cutaneous Epithelioid Angiomatous Nodule.
The section shows well-circumscribed, homogeneous, eosinophilic, amorphous material, accompanied by an infiltrate of lymphocytes and plasma cells. Consistent with amyloidoma.
6_Pneumonia: The section shows patchy intraalveolar edema and interstitial inflammation. The interstitium is densely infiltrated by eosinophils, accompanied by multinucleated giant cells, scattered histiocytes, and plasma cells.Consistent with Chronic Eosinophilic Pneumonia.

Interstitial infiltrate of lymphocytes, plasma cells, and histiocytes, with cholesterol deposition and multinucleated giant cell formation. The alveolar architecture is preserved.Consistent with Hypersensitivity Pneumonitis.

Polypoid proliferation is seen within the alveolar spaces. The lung tissue exhibits a mild to moderate inflammatory infiltrate, characterized by thickened alveolar septa containing lymphocytes, plasma cells, and histiocytes.Consistent with Organizing Pneumonia.
7_Pneumothorax: Alveolar dilation, septal destruction, alveolar fusion, pulmonary bullae formation, rupture openings are visible, and the surrounding lung tissue is subtracted.
The lung tissue shows extensive emphysematous changes, with bullae and a rupture site, and fibrinous exudate on the pleural surface.
8_Consolidation: Massive confluent exudate with intra-alveolar neutrophils, red cells and fibrin
9_Edema: Alveolar septa are diffusely widened by accumulated edema fluid.
Pulmonary capillaries and lymphatic vessels are dilated and engorged.
Alveolar spaces contain homogeneous, pale pink-staining edema fluid.
10_Emphysema: Elongated or angulated spaces in fibrotic interstitium. Surrounded by dense fibrosis and lining of multiple giant cells.
11_Fibrosis: Well-circumscribed plaques of dense, hyalinized, acellular collagen.
prominent stromal hyalinization, compressed and thin walled vessels.
There is a diffuse proliferation of fibroblasts and myofibroblasts within the interstitium, accompanied by a scant lymphocytic infiltrate and mild collagen deposition.
12_PleuralThickening: Reactive hyperplasia of submesothelial fibroconnective tissue.
13_Hernia: The fibrocystic wall with extensive edema, no lining epithelium
Adipose tissue within sac; dilated vessels, congestion, and chronic inflammation in sac wall.
The content within the fibrous sac wall consists of peritoneum and adipose tissue; the neck of the sac shows prominent fibrous thickening.
14_COVID19: Chest X-ray demonstrating bilateral, peripheral predominant patchy ground-glass opacities with lower-lobe emphasis, consistent with COVID-19 pneumonia.
Radiograph showing multifocal hazy air-space opacities in both lungs without a single lobar distribution, suggestive of viral pneumonia such as COVID-19.
Image depicting progressive diffuse bilateral opacification with worsening oxygenation features, compatible with severe COVID-19â€“related acute lung injury/ARDS.
